claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A partial screenshot of the title page of a Vaccine journal article (Elsevier), showing the journal header, homepage URL, and the beginning of the article title: “Vaccine effectiveness of recombinant and standard dose influenza vaccines against influenza related hospitalization using a retrospective…”. does not support the claim because the image only shows the journal header and article title without presenting any data or statements about mutations arising during cell- or egg-based vaccine production or their impact on effectiveness. Note: Only the header and title are visible; no figure or data on manufacturing-induced mutations is present in the visible portion.
